message.content: The generated code currently stores users and chats in memory, which means that all data will be lost if the server restarts. To improve this, you could use a database to persistently store users and chats. This would allow data to be retained across server restarts and also enable more complex queries and data manipulation.

function_call.name: write_files

message.content: The test for the login function is failing because it's comparing the user ID generated during the test with the user ID generated during the actual login process. Since UUIDs are unique and random, these will not match. A better approach would be to check if the returned user ID exists in the users dictionary after the login process. This would ensure that the user was successfully logged in.

message.content: The current implementation does not handle the case where a user tries to register with an email that is already in use. To improve this, you could add a check in the register function to see if the email is already associated with an existing user. If it is, you could return an error message to the user indicating that the email is already in use.
